question: List all the different temperatures that a user has cooked onions.

events.method: briefly heated on the surface of the pan

events.outcome: Sauce was OK; almost none of the onion flavor came through despite strong aromatics in the bag.

evidence.excerpt: I put them in a sous vide in about 165 with some butter and then I put that through a sieve and I mixed it in with some egg and mustard and it was OK but like the taste was OK but almost none of the onion flavor came out

events.outcome: Had been in the refrigerator for a few days; tasted OK but not great (possible loss of pungency).

evidence.excerpt: I used existing caramelized onions that I had in the fridge they were there for a few days and only tasted OK they weren’t bad but they weren’t great.

events.temperature: ≈350–400°F (user said between 350° and a little above 400°)
events.outcome: Fried for about 5 minutes, flipping sides.

evidence.excerpt: It was too doughy on the sides so I had the idea of shallow frying it. That’s why I switched it to about a 5 1/2 inch egg pan and put in some olive oil oil so I could cover more of the bottom. Try to fry it between 350° but you know reached out to above a little bit 400 probably did that for about five minutes flipping sides.

events.outcome: sweet, very nutty butter after straining; became even sweeter on repeat; final volume reduced by ~25–33%

evidence.excerpt: I diced up some onions and put it in a small pan and try to keep the temperature to about 250° ... I probably put like 2 tablespoons of butter ... it gets brown almost like it’s frying while it’s foaming ... the after result is a pretty sweet very nutty butter once it’s strained. And then I did that again and it got even sweeter ... it reduces by like maybe 1/3 to 1/4
